Address.college_name: Academy of Economic Studies of Moldova
Address.university_name: Academia de Studii Economice din Moldova (ASEM)

GeneralInformation.History: The Academy of Economic Studies of Moldova (ASEM) was founded on September 25, 1991, based on Decision no. 537 of the Government of the Republic of Moldova. Currently, it is the main public higher educational institution with economic profile in Moldova comprising a university complex, within which 6 faculties with 26 departments, 2 departments, 7 centers, 13 services, the Master's School of Excellence in Economics and Business, the Doctoral School, National College of Commerce and National Institute of Economic Research.
GeneralInformation.AcademicYear: September to December; January to May
AdmissionRequirements: Diploma de Bacalaureat (or equivalent secondary school certificate)

Address.university_name: Academia de Muzică, Teatru şi Arte Plastice (AMTAP)

GeneralInformation.History: Founded 1940. Reorganised into Institute of Arts 1964. Reorganised into Moldova State University of Arts 1998. Acquired present status and title 2002
AdmissionRequirements: Secondary school certificate in Romanian and entrance examination
For the applicants to the Music and Fine Arts, diploma or certificate of vocational school

Divisions.College: Fine and Decorative Art and Design
